body_html:
I looked a bit into the usage of CuDNN in TensorFlow, especially cudnnConvolutionForward. It's a piece of code of modest size and contains complicated logics for algorithm selection. Since not all forward convolution algorithms support group-based convolution, I think it'll be faster for someone who is familiar with that part of code to add this functionality.

Also, to support an API change in C++ level, we also need to implement the CPU-only version. I'm afraid I don't have enough time for this in the near term.

I'm happy to flesh out a pure API change patch in Python (i.e. without the actual C++ impl) based on #10482 if that seems useful. Otherwise, please feel free to use any code in that PR.

body:
I looked a bit into the usage of CuDNN in TensorFlow, especially `cudnnConvolutionForward`. It's a piece of code of modest size and contains complicated logics for algorithm selection. Since not all forward convolution algorithms support group-based convolution, I think it'll be faster for someone who is familiar with that part of code to add this functionality.

Also, to support an API change in C++ level, we also need to implement the CPU-only version. I'm afraid I don't have enough time for this in the near term.

I'm happy to flesh out a pure API change patch in Python (i.e. without the actual C++ impl) based on #10482 if that seems useful. Otherwise, please feel free to use any code in that PR.
